definition: to retire from a government post (old)
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey
(bound form) fine/delicate
to serve as an official/an official/the two chess pieces in Chinese chess guarding the "general" or "king" 將|将[jiang4]

sentences.english: Officials' had to resign in the case of over 70 years old.
sentences.chinese: 元代规定官员的致仕年龄为70岁。

sentences.english: Yuan's official retirement system has not only features of past dynasties but also it's uniqueness.
sentences.chinese: 元代致仕制度既有以往历代的特点，也有其本身特色。

sentences.english: The retiring system was an important part of the official system in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 致仕制度是中国古代文官制度的重要组成部分。

sentences.english: Wo first to the right Bastard retirement, four items to the ticket and return home from Xiang was the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 太和初，以右庶子致仕，四品给券还乡自珦始。

definition: to resign a government post
to request permission to resign from an official position (old)
to dismiss from office/to resign from office
Director of Board of Rites (Confucian)
to take up an official post
Minister of Revenue (from the Han dynasty onwards)
to go into mourning for one's parents
imperial censor (formal title of a dynastic official)
ancient official title/assistant minister
senior provincial government official in dynastic China
(of a court official) to present a memorial to the emperor (old)
demotion/to have one's job cut
members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
Imperial Hanlin Academy, lasting from Tang dynasty until 1911
demotion to commoner (idiom)
local magistrate
